author: pipermerriam
content:
Quick call notes:

- existing discv5 rust implementation needs a little work to better support TALKREQ/RESP API  (Sam and maybe ftruzzi are going to look into that)
- status has candidates in the pipe and are having forward progress with getting their position filled
- expecting it to take a few weeks here to really get moving and get these new implementations off the ground.

author: jason.carver
content: > the issue is that the way discv5 rust handles talkreq messages is a bit limiting. Currently, it uses a pure function callback we can define which takes  (request, protocol)  bytes and returns the response. This doesn't work for our usecase where we need access to the discv5 dht to respond to FindNode requests (so it can't be a pure function). Also I think there hasn't been much thought put into the talkreq api (atleast in rust) because nobody uses it yet
